Detailed Description

Class for doing probe set quantification using the PLIER (Probe Logarithmic Error Intensity Estimate) method.

SelfCreate * QuantPlier::newObject ( std::map< std::string, std::string > &  param  )  [static]

This static function should be overridden by child classes to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly with the parameters in the string, string map.

All objects created this way should be deleted when finished using. The default values used for the plier parameters are from the inputs.txt file in the sdk example.

Parameters:
param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
Returns:
Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.

Reimplemented from SelfCreate.

Reimplemented in QuantSea.

void QuantPlier::setFeaturePriorEffects ( double *  featureEffects,
int  iSize 
) [virtual]

Specify precomputed feature effects to be used as map from probe id index to the feature effect.

This make plier much faster to do as doesn't have to iterate through anything, but have to make sure that the feature effects being used match the analysis that is being done. For example the feature effects might be different using pm-only, pm-gcbg and pm-mm adjustments.

Parameters:
featureEffects - mapping from probe idex to feature effects.

Implements QuantPlierBase.

Definition at line 181 of file QuantPlier.cpp.
